newsitem.title: USA: Spyglass still comfortable with estimates.
newsitem.headline: Spyglass still comfortable with estimates.

text.p: Spyglass Inc chief executive Doug Colbeth said Monday the company is still comfortable with analysts' expectations that it will post a loss of a few cents a share in the first half of fiscal 1997 but have a profit for the full year.

"The analysts have shown us losing money the first two quarters (of fiscal 1997) and show us making money the last two," Colbeth said in a telephone interview. "I can say I'm comfortable with that but would caution that obviously we're in a new market opportunity."
His statements reiterated comments made by other company executives in October.

According to First Call, the mean earnings consensus for the first quarter ending in December is a loss of $0.01 a share, compared with a year-ago profit of $0.06. For the year, the consensus is a profit of $0.09 a share, down from a profit of $0.27 in fiscal 1996.

In October the company said it would turn its research and development resources to the Internet device market, a move that could possibly lead to a loss in the first half of its fiscal 1997 of a few cents a share.
